professional_experience:
Amazon.com, Inc. - Irvine, CA - Software Development Engineer II (Jul 2023 - Present):

• Lead and launch Amazon's flagship social proof feature - 'X+ bought in past month':
Context: Product team identified Amazon's lack of social proof features after competitor analysis. Upper management approved this large-scope project requiring significant project leadership and cross-team collaboration.
Action: As project lead, designed and implemented APIs and core business logic supporting this feature across Search, Detail pages, and Cart. Collaborated with frontend engineers, data engineers, and DevOps teams. Built backend in Amazon's in-house Ion-based language, implemented robust data validation pipelines and caching strategies for billion-customer scale. Conducted rigorous A/B testing and iterated based on customer engagement metrics.
Achievement: Successfully delivered and launched the social proof feature, driving $400 million increase in annual revenue while boosting customer trust and engagement.

• Tier-1 service NAWS (native AWS) migration:
Context: Led migration of DigitalRecommendationsService (1M+ TPS, 10+ years old) from outdated VM-based infrastructure to native AWS to reduce operational burden and costs.
Action: Volunteered for core team, migrated service logic to AWS ECS using CDK, implemented CI/CD pipelines and monitoring for Tier-1 requirements (five-nine reliability, P90 latency <200ms). Migrated hardware load balancer to AWS ALB, troubleshooting network routing issues and establishing detailed rollback plans.
Achievement: Migrated 50% of Tier-1 service to native AWS, reduced infrastructure costs by 30% and oncall burden by 25%.

• Addressing CEO escalation for Haul store order confirmation email:
Context: CEO Andy Jassy received order confirmation email from new Haul store (<$20 items) showing regular retail recommendations (>$20), creating poor customer experience.
Action: Immediately volunteered for extremely urgent task, created robust tech design breaking down required steps, formed task force with Haul store and email delivery teams, hosted twice-daily standups to meet 1-week deadline.
Achievement: Implemented email templating changes, Haul-based recommendations, and frontend components before deadline. Received CEO recognition for Bias for Action.

• Digital Markets Act (DMA) compliance ownership:
Context: Led org-wide EU DMA compliance implementation across multiple services and datasets.
Action: Conducted comprehensive document review, created detailed summary for team alignment, hosted weekly meetings with sister teams to ensure collaborative implementation within deadline.
Achievement: First org to complete DMA compliance in entire Personalization division, received management praise for bias for action.

• Developed Linear Bayesian ML model for Amazon's Digital contents:
Context: Digital team wanted to leverage recommendation system for promoting digital contents (Ebook, Audible, Prime Video, Music) on retail stores.
Action: Explored ML system integration feasibility, redesigned approach to create digital-specific model after senior feedback. Collaborated with Digital team for training data, resolved cache configuration issues independently.
Achievement: Created and trained new digital content model, launched 'Top picks for you in digital' strategy worldwide, generating $30 million revenue growth.

Amazon.com, Inc. - Irvine, CA - Software Development Engineer I (Feb 2022 – Jun 2023):

• Data ETL pipelines migration to native AWS:
Context: Migrated costly VM-based ETL pipelines supporting key recommendation features to native AWS for significant infrastructure savings.
Action: As new hire, explored AWS tools (S3, Glue, Lambda, Step Functions, Batch, ECS, Fargate), created comprehensive design document, implemented new infrastructure using AWS CDK.
Achievement: Migrated 5 ETL pipelines from VM-based to native AWS infrastructure, achieving 90% reduction in infrastructure costs.

• Internal tooling (Cradle) infrastructure and codebase migration:
Context: Migrated organization's shared Cradle infrastructure to team-specific infrastructures for better cost clarity and operational control.
Action: Led project under senior guidance, created CDK pipelines and packages, presented new infrastructure to team, provided migration instructions for 10 team members.
Achievement: Migrated 26 Cradle profiles within one week, reduced CI/CD pipeline blockage by 95% and infrastructure costs by 30%.

• 1P device ML model testing and launch:
Context: Collaborated with 1P device data science team to test Neural-Network ML model predicting customer device purchases within 15 days.
Action: Led collaboration as recommendation system owner, hosted requirement meetings, designed testing plan including recommendation strategy creation and A/B testing methodology.
Achievement: Created data pipeline and launched new recommendation strategy, generating $20 million yearly revenue growth and 1 million extra device sales.

• Audible à la carte (ALC) offer testing and launch:
Context: Tested new Audible pricing model showing single-item purchase prices to improve customer shopping experience.
Action: Researched Audible-related pages and recommendation slots, designed ALC pricing experiments using frontend library, conducted strict code reviews, performed deep-dive analysis including metric resolution and segmentation analysis.
Achievement: Launched ALC pricing model worldwide, generating $5 million annual Audible sales revenue.

• Audible Premium Plus member CX improvement:
Context: Improved shopping experience for Premium Plus members who can purchase books with monthly credits.
Action: Designed new customer experience combining ALC price with credit purchase option, collaborated with UX design teams on fonts, colors, translations, implemented in frontend library with stakeholder approval.
Achievement: Launched improved CX worldwide, generating $2 million annual Audible sales revenue.

TRUMPF Photonics, Inc. - Cranbury, NJ - Senior R&D Engineer (Jan 2019 – Dec 2021):

• Automation recipe development for laser chip bonding equipment:
Context: Led automation project for semiconductor packaging production line with laser chip bonding machines to address human turnover, operation errors, and production yield loss.
Action: Applied computer vision and ML expertise to establish automation workflows, identified pain points and key features, developed automation recipes using Python and CNN models.
Achievement: Achieved sub-micron precision alignment, reduced human errors by 95%, improved production yield by 20%.

• BI reporting system for C-Suite management:
Context: Created automated BI reporting system to replace manual Excel-based reporting for CEO presentations and headquarters reporting.
Action: Collaborated with IT department, created data pipelines using Apache Airflow and Spark, built batch jobs for production data collection, developed charts and dashboards using Kibana.
Achievement: Reduced manual reporting work by 90%, ensured data integrity and error-free key reports.

IBM/GlobalFoundries - Malta, NY - Senior R&D Engineer (May 2015 – Nov 2018):

• Automation recipe development for Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM):
Context: Developed automation for billion-dollar semiconductor manufacturer's TEM equipment used for failure analysis and material characterization to address high training requirements, human errors, and equipment damage.
Action: Self-taught programming, computer vision, ML, and deep learning in spare time despite no prior coding knowledge. Created 50+ automation recipes using OpenCV, scikit-learn, and TensorFlow.
Achievement: Established complete automation flow doubling productivity with improved image quality, reduced equipment downtime due to human errors by 30%.
education: M.S. in Computer and Information Technology - University of Pennsylvania (Jan 2020 - Dec 2021): Built foundation of software engineering, including data structure, algorithm, computer system, operating system, software design, database, machine learning and computer vision. Earned Master's degree while holding full-time job, GPA: 3.97. Ph.D. in Materials Science and Engineering - Virginia Tech (Sep 2012 - May 2015): Research focused on nanomaterial-based semiconductor material for power semiconductor chips. Published 11 peer-reviewed papers, GPA: 3.50.
